data.title: Showif statement.
data.body:
It would be nice to have a SL showif statement, which would be used like:

```
showif flag:
    text "Foo" at my_transform
```

The general idea of this statement would be that it shows and hides the text using the show/hide algorithm, so that ATL transforms with "on show" and "on hide" clauses would work properly inside a screen.

data.title: Doucument error about edgescroll
data.body:
In document, the third element of edgescroll is a function that adjusts the scrolling speed, and it should take a number between 0.0 and 1.0.

But actually, it takes a number between -1.0 and 1.0.

While loading the script.
IOError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument

  File "C:\Users\chandra\Downloads\game\pc game\renpy\renpy-6.17.6-sdk\renpy\bootstrap.py", line 285, in bootstrap

    f.seek(-md5.digest_size, 2)
IOError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument

Windows-7-6.1.7601-SP1
Ren'Py 6.17.6.512

data.title: action RollForward() exits from rollback context
data.body:
Unlike pagedown key, screen action RollForward() exits from rollback context as if it causes dismiss.
How to reproduce:
On the tutorial game, add the following code:

```
screen say(who, what, side_image=None, two_window=False):
    key 'z' action RollForward()
    if renpy.in_rollback():
        text "in_rollback"
    else:
        text "not_in_rollback"
```

Then start the tutorial game, read a bit, press pageup key to cause rollback.
While pressing pageup or pagedown, it always shows "in_rollback". But if "z" is pressed to cause RollForward(), it shows "not_in_rollback", which means this action exits from rollback context.

data.title: Fixing mistakes on the Language Basics doc page
data.body: I was reading through the docs and found some mistakes in the Language Basics page. There was a trailing incomplete sentence fragment in the `True, False, None` section and a mistake in the `Tuple` section.

data.body: Where possible.

data.title: Jerky edgescrolling
data.body:
Testing a small scene with 2 scrolling layers. Performance was fine, but if I click on another program (like google chrome) and then return to the VN, the scrolling becomes very jerky.

Tested in 6.17 and 6.18 with the same result.

Can provide a demo if required.

System:
    OS: Windows 7 Professional 32-bit
    CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU     E8400  @ 3.00GHz (2 CPUs), ~3.0GHz
    RAM: 4096MB 
    Onboard graphics (Intel(R) GMA 3100, 256MB display memory)

data.title: Forgot to put the file [DroidSansFallback.ttf] in directory /launcher/game/tl/simplified_chinese??
data.body:
Hey dear Tom, 

I think you might forget to put the file DroidSansFallback.ttf in the directory /launcher/game/tl/simplified_chinese ?

![chinese](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8366594/3870345/3292e198-20c9-11e4-890a-66818c9732a6.png)

I updated my Renpy engine today (version 6.17.7.521) and when I tried to switch to the Chinese language, suddenly the engine crashed...and it simply couldn't recover itself LOL 

![chinese01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8366594/3870377/02033c60-20cb-11e4-96a8-86079ba77b11.png)

So I followed the traceback, downloaded the DroidSansFallback.ttf and put it where it should be, everything was fine as usual. 

Hope this could be fixed in the new version:)

data.title: An exception has occurred while installing Android SDK
data.body:
I tried to build an Android version of my game, and the Renpy engine said "needs to install Android SDK"

![issue02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8366594/3867394/490bcbf0-1ffd-11e4-896b-301c0040f659.png)

ok, go ahead...then an exception jumped in my way. Like this:

![issue01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8366594/3867393/3cc92f04-1ffd-11e4-80c5-c457b98201c8.png)

I restarted the Renpy engine and installed Android SDK severel times...and every time I stucked at the same point, as showed.

I'll try to install Android SDK by myself to see if this problem can be fixed...

By the way, I run the Renpy engine on: 

![mac](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8366594/3867404/bcd64092-1ffd-11e4-9aa2-72f5be981096.png)

data.title: Linux x86_64 version of renpy sdk uses system python instead of shipped version
data.body:
Hello, 

I'm trying to track down an issue which is preventing me from playing the Steam version of Sakura Spirit on Linux. While I was able to run the game the first time (my window manager went nuts and I had to control c it) after that I get the following error in the console:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jwscoggins/.local/share/Steam/SteamApps/common/Sakura Spirit/Sakura Spirit.py", line 164, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/jwscoggins/.local/share/Steam/SteamApps/common/Sakura Spirit/Sakura Spirit.py", line 161, in main
    renpy.bootstrap.bootstrap(renpy_base)
  File "/home/jwscoggins/.local/share/Steam/SteamApps/common/Sakura Spirit/renpy/bootstrap.py", line 261, in bootstrap
    renpy.import_all()
  File "/home/jwscoggins/.local/share/Steam/SteamApps/common/Sakura Spirit/renpy/**init**.py", line 144, in import_all
    import renpy.style #@UnresolvedImport
ImportError: No module named style
Game removed: AppID 313740 "Sakura Spirit", ProcID 25371

Since I wanted to be able to tinker, I downloaded the renpy-sdk-6.17.3 (same version as Sakura Spirit runs) and was treated to the same error when I ran ./renpy.sh. 

Tweaking that shell script so x86_64 still uses the i686 version actually yielded success. 
So running lib/linux-x86_64/python yielded a shell which was identical to my system version of python. So it seems that the 64-bit version shipped with the sdk is not being used and the system version is. 

Do you have any ideas how to change this? I'm not even sure what to search Google for.

My system is: 
- Gentoo Linux amd64
- Python 2.7.6 (built with gcc 4.8.2), Python 3.2.0, Python 3.3.0
